revised_title: Hemisection and Degeneration in the Spinal Cord: Observations and Experiments
tldr: The author discusses the effects of hemisection and degeneration in the spinal cord, observing that vaso-motor disturbances occur on the same side as the lesion. Experiments on stimulation of the cortex cerebri show that the block in the spinal cord persists even with a return of associated movements. This research contributes to the understanding of the origin and course of certain long and short tract fibers in the spinal cord.
